item.title: The votes are in: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 Audience Choice winners revealed for roundtables and breakouts
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: You voted — they made it onto the TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 agenda! After reviewing hundreds of standout Call for Content submissions and opening the vote to the TechCrunch audience, we’ve locked in the top five roundtables and top five breakout sessions. Without further ado, meet the exceptional tech voices — and the sessions they’ll lead […]

item.title: Tomorrow: TechCrunch All Stage launches in Boston — and ticket prices rise
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage officially kicks off tomorrow at 7:30 a.m. ET at SoWa Power Station in Boston — and that’s when ticket prices jump to full rate. This isn’t just another founder event. It’s the summit built to help startups fundraise smarter, scale faster, and lead with impact. Whether you’re tightening your pitch, planning a […]

item.title: Elmo’s X account hacked to publish racist and antisemetic posts
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: A hacker compromised Elmo's X account on Sunday and published abusive posts.

item.title: Discord’s virtual reward, ‘Orbs,’ launches out of beta
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: According to Discord, Orbs have been popular among testers, with millions earned and spent during the seven-week beta period.

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s latest app tracks sun exposure
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey's new app, called Sun Day, ostensibly helps users track UV exposure and Vitamin D intake.

item.title: Meta acquires voice startup Play AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Meta has acquired Play AI, a startup that uses AI to generate human-sounding voices.

item.title: Study warns of ‘significant risks’ in using AI therapy chatbots
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Therapy chatbots powered by large language models may stigmatize users with mental health conditions and otherwise respond inappropriately or even dangerously, according to researchers at Stanford University.

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX might invest $2 billion in Musk’s xAI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: One Elon Musk business might be making a big investment in another.

item.title: UK launches £500M package to support diverse, underrepresented investors and founders
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The British Business Bank, owned by the UK government, is creating a £500 million (around $674 million) economic package to help support diverse and underrepresented fund managers and founders in the country.  Fifty million pounds will be set aside for female-led venture funds, which means the BBB has now committed at least £100 million (around […]

item.title: The countdown’s almost over: 2 days until TechCrunch All Stage 2025 kicks off in Boston
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch All Stage 2025 is almost here — In 2 days, the doors swing open at Boston’s SoWa Power Station. If you’re a founder or investor, this is your last shot to lock in the lowest ticket prices before they vanish at the door. This isn’t your average startup conference. TC All Stage is where […]

item.title: A United Nations research institute created an AI refugee avatar
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A research institute connected to the United Nations has created two AI-powered avatars designed to teach people about refugee issues. 404 Media wrote about an experiment conducted by a class at the United Nations University Center for Policy Research that resulted in the creation of two AI agents or avatars — Amina, a fictional woman […]

item.title: Marc Andreessen reportedly told group chat that universities will ‘pay the price’ for DEI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Venture capitalist Marc Andreessen sharply criticized universities including Stanford and MIT, along with the National Science Foundation, in a group chat with AI scientists and Trump administration officials, according to screenshots viewed by the Washington Post.

item.title: Week in Review: X CEO Linda Yaccarino steps down
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! We’ve got tons of news for you this week, including a shakeup at X, Hugging Face’s new robot, new phones from Nothing and Samsung, and a whole lot more. Have a great weekend! Off to do something else: X CEO Linda Yaccarino stepped down this week after a tumultuous […]

item.title: xAI and Grok apologize for ‘horrific behavior’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
In a series of posts on X, the AI chatbot Grok apologized for what it admitted was “horrific behavior.”
The posts appear to be an official statement from xAI, the Elon Musk-led company behind Grok, as opposed to an AI-generated explanation for Grok’s posts. (xAI recently acquired X, where Grok is prominently featured.)

item.title: Just 3 days left to save before TechCrunch All Stage 2025 lights up Boston
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: In only 3 days, founders, investors, and operators will flood into the SoWa Power Station in Boston for TechCrunch All Stage 2025 — and if you haven’t grabbed your pass yet, this is your final window to lock in the lowest prices available and save up to $475. Whether you’re a first-time founder or a […]

item.title: Sequoia bets on silence
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: There is a time-honored crisis management strategy, wherein one says nothing and waits for the outrage to pass. For Sequoia Capital, the strategy worked pretty well this week. While partner Shaun Maguire initially weathered criticism over an inflammatory social media post, that initial indignation cooled quickly. Now, some seem to think that Maguire’s defiant stance […]

item.title: OpenAI delays the release of its open model, again
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said Friday the company is delaying the release of its open model indefinitely.

item.title: Windsurf’s CEO goes to Google; OpenAI’s acquisition falls apart
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Notably, Google is not taking a stake in Windsurf and will not have any control over the company.

item.title: Firefly Aerospace files for an IPO
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: Firefly is heading into the initial public offering with $176.9 million in cash and cash equivalents. And while it has incurred negative cash flows and losses from operations, Firefly projected that its cash is adequate to meet its liquidity needs for at least 12 months.

item.title: Can an ‘ethical’ spyware maker justify providing its tech to ICE?
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Analysis: In calling itself an ethical spyware vendor, Paragon has opened itself up to scrutiny of its government customers.
